required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Safety and Efficacy Study of BMS-986165 in Participants With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center Study to Characterize the Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of BMS-986165 in Subjects With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the trial is to characterize the long-term safety and tolerability of BMS-986165 in subjects with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants who successfully complete the protocol-required treatment period of the Phase 2 SLE study (NCT03252587) will be offered the opportunity to continue study
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after last treatment dose (approximately 108 weeks)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after last treatment dose (approximately 108 weeks)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with AEs leading to discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after last treatment dose (approximately 108 weeks)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormal change from baseline in laboratory measurements over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after last treatment dose (approximately 108 weeks)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with abnormal change from baseline in vital signs over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after last treatment dose (approximately 108 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completion of SLE Study (NCT03252587) through the protocol-required treatment period, and currently receiving blinded study drug
- Women of childbearing potential (WOCBP) must have a negative urine pregnancy test and must agree to use correctly a highly effective method(s) of contraception for the duration of treatment with study drug
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any disease or medical condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, would make the subject unsuitable for this study, would interfere with the interpretation of subject safety or study results, or considered unsuitable by the investigator for any other reason
- Evidence of active tuberculosis (TB)
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply

overall_contact.last_name: Recruiting sites have contact information. Please contact the sites directly. If there is no contact information,
